intro: Pseudognaphalium andicola, commonly known as the Andean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cooler and more temperate climates. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Pseudognaphalium andicola is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
